meanings.definition: To grant a license to someone to operate a business under your company's name.
meanings.sent1: The company is francizing its popular coffee shop to a new owner.
meanings.sent2: She decided to francize her successful bakery and expand it to other cities.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he would francize his disappearing act to other performers.
meanings.sent4: The idea to francize the business spread like wildfire among entrepreneurs.
meanings.sent5: By francizing their business, they were able to reach a wider market.

meanings.definition: The act of expanding a business by granting licenses to others to operate under your brand.
meanings.sent1: Francizing can help a company grow and reach new customers.
meanings.sent2: The francizing of their restaurant chain was a huge success.
meanings.sent3: The concept of francizing a business seemed like a smart move to many investors.
meanings.sent4: The francizing of the company's products made them more accessible to consumers.
meanings.sent5: She saw the potential of francizing her clothing line and took the leap.

meanings.definition: The process of establishing a franchise system for a business.
meanings.sent1: The francizing of the company required careful planning and organization.
meanings.sent2: He studied the francizing process to understand how to expand his business.
meanings.sent3: The team worked together to streamline the francizing of their services.
meanings.sent4: The francizing of the business was a major milestone for the company.
meanings.sent5: She dedicated herself to mastering the francizing of their brand.
